2025-08-27.versiculo: Acts 1:8 NVI: "But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth."
2025-08-27.reflexion: Acts 1:8 is a cornerstone of Christian mission. It's not just a suggestion; it's a commission, a divine mandate. Jesus, before ascending to heaven, outlines the power source for the task ahead: the Holy Spirit. This power isn't just about performing miracles; it's about equipping believers to be authentic witnesses. Notice the geographical progression: Jerusalem, the center of their lives, is the starting point. Then, the mission expands to Judea and Samaria, representing closer and more distant communities. Finally, the call extends to the ends of the earth. This verse challenges us to consider our own spheres of influence. Are we effective witnesses in our Jerusalem – our homes, workplaces, and immediate communities? Are we open to expanding our reach, sharing the Gospel with those beyond our comfort zones? The promise of power, of the Holy Spirit's presence, is a constant encouragement. It’s not about our abilities, but about His. Embrace the power, embrace the commission, and be a witness for Christ, wherever you are, however you can.

para_meditar.texto: But the Advocate, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you all things and will remind you of everything I have said to you.
In the same way, the Spirit helps us in our weakness. We do not know what we ought to pray for, but the Spirit himself intercedes for us through wordless groans.

Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.”

2025-08-27.oracion: Heavenly Father, we thank you for the promise of the Holy Spirit, the power that empowers us to be witnesses for your love and grace. Help us to be bold and courageous in sharing the good news of Jesus Christ, starting in our own Jerusalem and extending to the ends of the earth. Give us the wisdom to recognize opportunities to share our faith, the courage to speak the truth, and the compassion to love others as you have loved us. Fill us with your Spirit, enabling us to live lives that reflect your glory and draw others to you. Guide our steps, sharpen our words, and open our hearts to the needs of those around us. May we be faithful witnesses in every aspect of our lives, bringing glory to your name, in the name of Jesus, amen.

2025-08-28.versiculo: 1 John 4:1 NVI: "Dear friends, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits to see whether they are from God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world."
2025-08-28.reflexion: Today's verse, 1 John 4:1, serves as a crucial warning and a call to discernment. John urges us not to be naive or gullible, but to critically evaluate the messages we receive, especially those claiming spiritual authority. The phrase "do not believe every spirit" underscores the reality that not all spiritual influences are from God. This is not about being cynical or suspicious, but about being vigilant and wise. We are called to "test the spirits," which means to examine the teachings and claims against the standard of God's Word. This is a practical application of the wisdom found throughout Scripture, from the prophets of the Old Testament to the teachings of Jesus. The warning is clear: "many false prophets have gone out into the world." This means that deception is pervasive and that we must be prepared to identify and resist it. This testing is not just an intellectual exercise; it requires a heart submitted to God, a love for truth, and a willingness to be corrected by the Holy Spirit. It is a vital practice for maintaining our spiritual health and protecting ourselves from being led astray. The underlying motivation for this discernment is love: love for God, and love for those we want to protect from falsehood.

para_meditar.texto: The simple believe anything, but the prudent give thought to their steps.

Now the Berean Jews were of more noble character than those in Thessalonica, for they received the message with great eagerness and examined the Scriptures every day to see if what Paul said was true.
All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness,

2025-08-28.oracion: Lord, thank you for the warning in 1 John 4:1, a reminder to test the spirits and be discerning in a world filled with voices. Help me to be grounded in Your Word, to love truth, and to seek Your guidance in every situation. Grant me wisdom to discern between truth and falsehood, and to be led by Your Holy Spirit. Give me the strength to resist deception and to stand firm in my faith. I pray for those who are easily led astray; protect them and guide them back to You. Help me to be a light, sharing Your truth with others and leading them to a deeper relationship with You. Enable me to speak the truth in love, always seeking to honor You in my words and actions. In the name of Jesus, amen.

2025-08-29.versiculo: 1 John 4:11 NVI: "Dear friends, since God loved us that much, we also ought to love one another."
2025-08-29.reflexion: Today's verse, 1 John 4:11, provides a powerful call to action: "Dear friends, since God loved us that much, we also ought to love one another." This verse is not just a suggestion; it's a direct consequence of experiencing God's love. The magnitude of God's love for us, demonstrated through the ultimate sacrifice of Jesus, sets the standard for our relationships.  It's a love that transcends our imperfections, our flaws, and our unworthiness.  We are called to reciprocate this boundless love by extending it to others, even those who are difficult to love.  This kind of love is not merely an emotion, but a deliberate choice, an act of the will. It involves empathy, compassion, and a willingness to serve. It requires us to see others through the lens of grace, just as God sees us.  Loving one another is the tangible expression of our faith, the evidence that we truly understand and have received God's love.  It is in loving others that we reflect God's character and fulfill the very purpose for which we were created.  This love is the foundation of the Christian community and the cornerstone of our witness to the world.

para_meditar.texto: "A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another."
"Be devoted to one another in love. Honor one another above yourselves."
"Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud."

2025-08-29.oracion: Heavenly Father, thank you for Your immeasurable love, a love that surpasses all understanding. Help me to grasp the depth and breadth of Your grace, which You have so freely given to me.  Grant me the strength and the wisdom to love others as You have loved me.  Open my heart to see the needs of those around me and to respond with compassion and kindness.  Help me to forgive those who have wronged me and to extend grace even when it is difficult.  May my actions reflect Your love, bringing glory to Your name and drawing others closer to You.  Fill me with Your Holy Spirit, so that I may love with Your love, a love that is patient, kind, and enduring.  In the name of Jesus, amen.
